meanings.definition: To bring oneself into favor with someone by flattering or trying to please them.
meanings.sent1: She ingratiated herself with the teacher by always offering to help with tasks.
meanings.sent2: He ingratiated himself with his boss by complimenting her work ethic.
meanings.sent3: The puppy ingratiated itself with the family by wagging its tail and giving kisses.
meanings.sent4: The politician ingratiated himself with the voters by promising lower taxes.
meanings.sent5: The new employee ingratiated herself with her colleagues by bringing in donuts for everyone.

meanings.definition: To establish oneself in the favor or good graces of someone, especially by deliberate effort.
meanings.sent1: They ingratiated themselves with the neighbors by helping with yard work.
meanings.sent2: The singer ingratiated herself with the audience by performing their favorite songs.
meanings.sent3: The cat ingratiated itself with the family by curling up in their laps and purring.
meanings.sent4: The student ingratiated himself with the teacher by always being prepared for class.
meanings.sent5: The chef ingratiated herself with the food critics by creating a unique and delicious menu.
